Description: A fragmentary pottery flask with a flattened circular body decorated in relief: a complex pattern of low curving lines of raised points within a double circle. Two small handles are at the base of a carinated neck. It is broken into three non-joining fragments. Two-piece mould. Dark-grey Nile silt, covered with a black slip (Memphis Black Ware).
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. Excavated at Tanis: Find 57, middle of South Tell. Ptolemaic, late third to second century BC. Bibliog: Favard-Meeks in: Brissaud and Zivie-Coche - Tanis 1987-1997, (1998) p.148, 156, pl. xvi:j.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3651 bis)
